title: After Game Screen
body:
This has been happening quite a few patches ago (I think around 7.8?) but I just ended up dealing with it by selecting the option that closes the client when the game starts. It gets really annoying because after the game the end result screen (and honor system) takes forever to load. It's not a huge issue but I thought if there was a fix out there it'd be nice to have it.

At the end of a game or after leaving a custom or ending spectate mode, instead of being greeted by the regular-sized client screen, I just see my desktop or whatever's in the background (in the case of this screenshot, it is the help/support boards) and just the smallest bit of the top left corner of the client.

Seems to be a rare-ish case as most of my friends don't seem to have this problem, nor have they heard of it. Just thought I'd put this out here. Maybe I should have made this post when it first happened but I kinda hoped it would fix itself on its own. And also I was lazy.

replies.body:
This can happen every once and awhile if your game configuration files go a little wonky. Basically the resolution for the game client got messed up which is why it's showing up so tiiiiiiny. Let's give those config files a quick reset following these steps and you should be good to go.

- Log into the game client
- Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
- Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
- Go into a practice game and verify that settings have saved properly. 
- Leave game to sync settings

Hmm, it looks like the problem comes back when I set the resolution to 1024 x 768 (which is what I kept it at before). Is there some way around this? Or should I just adjust to a different resolution?

Man that one res just doesn't wanna work now does it. I talked to some of my tech guys, and they mentioned that an out of ordinary monitor res might be the problem. For instance, some ultra-wide monitors can have some kind of awkward res's that may not work properly with certain client res's. 

Let me know what desktop resolution you're running, and we might be able to get to the bottom of that.
I'm currently running 1366 x 768 on my desktop

Hah! It worked! Thanks so much, it's like finally having a rotten tooth removed! One that's been annoying the crud out of me for the past 8 patches.
You're the best! :D
